title: Is it true that Pakhto was derived from the language of the Jinns? Did Prophet Suleiman really have a son named Afghan, who asked his father to learn the language? If not, where did the language actually originate from? - Quora

response.answer_text: No this is stupid question to ask. Pashto is an Eastern Iranian language, it originated from an unknown Iranian language that was related to Old Persian and Avestan (like all other modern Iranian languages). It's origins are somewhat obscure, due to the fact that like the vast majority of languages it did not have a writing system for most of its history.

All are false. Pashto or Pakhto is an Iranian langauge whose language origin and classification (linguistic) tree is: Proto Human Langauge Borean Nostratic Eurasiatic Indo European Indo Iranian Iranian Eastern Iranian Pashto Who told you this fake fictional story! Why are you just spreading Islamic misconceptions! No such story is found anywhere!
